rComments: Professor Nicholas Terpstra is an average professor, or he was at least in HIS243. I feel that if you take on of his Renaissance classes youre going to receive a more enthusiastic and specific subject matter. However, in HIS243 I often got the feeling that Professor Terpstra hadnt organized his lectures accordingly and basically came off as if he
I did research under Professor Terpstra. Very professional and knowledgeable with a lot to contribute during meetings. Lets you off the reigns, perhaps too much. A joy to know.

Social History of the Renaissance was one of the best courses I've taken. The lectures were always inspiring, entertaining, and presented logically/very clear. Sometimes professors can be scatter-brained and it shows because my notes but I found it easy to organize my notes in his lecture. He's really funny too!
Exam is tmr at 9 am and no marks have been posted on blackboard! Engaging lecturer, but the major assignment is disconnected from lecture material.

He is really funny and engaging. I am not tremendously interested in the subject matter but I go to class just for him. He answers questions well and is approachable. Responds promptly to emails and goes out of his way for students. This is what you call a real professor.

He is the MOST DISORGANIZED prof I have ever had. No clear instructions on the assignments; the major essay topics were so outdated that it was hard to find secondary resources dated after the 1970s. The textbook was useless - never used it as his lectures were about completely different topics. Also, lectures were very vague. Never again!

Terpstra was enthusiastic and explained things very well. However, the lectures were slow moving. By the end of the semester we had to rush through the final topics and eliminate others because we were so behind. Not a bad prof, just a poorly structured term.

Great prof. It's clear he loves the subject. He's very funny, and his lectures are fascinating, especially when he gets into his storytelling mode (his telling of the Pazzi conspiracy was awesome). His exam was a little long, but overall, a very enjoyable experience.

Terpstra is the man, i'm currently taking his class and it is by far my favourite, not only of the year, but overall in university He's funny, entertaining, engaging the list goes on i highly recommend both him and his class
Gave very clear, clean lectures. Almost always had a joke to lighten the mood and very enthusiastic about the material. I enjoyed going to class a lot :)
professor terpstra is the BOMB he's hilarious and his lectures are really interesting and easy to follow. probably my favorite lecture was on the medicis, he's such a story teller :)
Fantastic, one of the best. His lectures were very well organized and he was so enthusiastic! Also, he was hilarious. He made coming to class something to look forward to.
Amazing prof, really funny. I always looked forward to his lectures.
Awesome prof!  Easily my favourite this year.
Good prof, enjoys teaching and I enjoyed being taught...

Took HIS243 and HIS 309. He is an entertaining and enlightening lecturer who really is really into the Renaissance (which is handy because he's head of the department). His lectures were really clear, he was helpful during and after class for Q and A, text was relative and analyzed in tut/lec, &available for office hours. Overall great experience.

The guy's a horrible prof. What can I say? He turned me off history for good! I'm studying sciences now and couldn't be happier. So in that sense it's hard to tell if he's good or bad. If you want a prof to do the same for you, take his class :)

Almost as good as Professor Pearl, but without the movie voice that keeps your attention and his specialty isn't witchcraft so should I choose to read his book I won't have to hide it.  Possibly the smartest person I've ever met.
Awesome lecturer.  Very entertaining.
Inspired and inspiring teacher.

Very funny Professor, always makes things entertaining and informative. Knows what he's talking about and is enthuastic about what he is teaching. Would take a class he's teaching again without hesitation. :)
My favourite class, the way he lectures makes it easy to take notes and he's funny.

I didn't think I'd like this class after the first lecture but it was AWESOME.  His lectures are fascinating and hilarious; you never tune out.  In addition, he's a nice guy.  He really cares about his students.  I was sad when this class ended too.

Dr. Terpstra is a well-organized, clear and inspiring lecturer.  He brings life to the course material because he so obviously loves what he teaches.  He's also funny and charming -- a delightfully attractive man.

This Prof is truly awesome! I never in my life thought that social history of the Renaissance could be interesting, but Prof. Terpstra made every class a joy to attend. He actually cares for his students, something very rare for a U of T professor! If you get a chance, TAKE ONE OF HIS CLASSES!

Your University experience is not complete unless you take a course taught by Dr. Terpstra.  His assignments are actually enjoyable, his lectures are clear and easy to follow, and he is extremely approachable.  Best of all, he cares about his students and chooses to look at them as fellow human beings which is awesome at the UofT.

He is the best kind of prof you can ever hope for. You can teach a monkey Japanese if you can find a way to relate to the material, and he knows how to relate the material to us.He is also very optomistic and cares to learn all his students names.
he once compared Purgatory to Hamilton, not a terrible place but not somewhere you want to spend long periods of time in.  Which makes him tops in my books.

Great Prof & great guy. Excellent course. He made the history come alive. I would take his class again in a second. The course wasn't too challenging, as long as you kept up to date with readings. He expected participation & rewarded you for it.
An excellent professor. Very approachable. Wants you to do well. Demonstrates great enthusiasm for course material.
i love this guy.  his class is the only one that makes me sad when it's over.  he can make anything interesting and he's genuinely interesting in his students.  5 stars
Difficult assignments, but very kndgable!
Not too shabby, I guess, but definitely a nice guy.
Had him at the U of R 7 years ago. I still remember him as one of the best profs ever. You work for your grades but he is a good and decent person. Plus, I think he's cute.
Absolutely lovely and caring prof who always makes sure that students feeling comfortable with course material.  Knowledgable and expert in his field, too!
An amazing prof who is very kind. Very charismatic.  Love Uncle Nick!!
AMAZING!
Excellent Professor. He communicates clearly with enthusiasm.
No Comments
really good, but not sexy
Also had him at U of R. Fabulous.
My hero prof. at L-C. Great person. M.W.'93
great prof
This is guy is amazing.  Makes the material funny and v. interesting.
